image.altText: two construction workers smiling in hi-vis near the shore by the ocean

props.synopsis: A Supreme Court judge has dismissed a Darwin construction company's bid to overturn a $550,000 fine it received after one of its employees was killed on a remote worksite in 2020.

title.children: Construction firm loses bid to overturn $550,000 fine after worker death

image.altText: Man speaks and points in parliament

props.synopsis: The NT Labor opposition claims the government pushed new sacred sites laws through parliament to help a hotel proposal at the Darwin Waterfront proceed.

title.children: Changes to NT sacred sites law pass parliament, to opposition criticism

image.altText: People letting off fireworks on a beach

props.synopsis: More than 100 tonnes of fireworks bound for the NT's Territory Day celebrations have been seized by NSW authorities, prompting the NT chief minister to appeal to the NSW premier.

title.children: More than 100 tonnes of Territory Day fireworks seized by NSW authorities

image.altText: A police car parked across a road, also cordoned off with police tape, in a town CBD.

props.synopsis: A man is in a critical condition after being stabbed "multiple times" in the chest during a brawl believed to have involved more than a dozen people in the Alice Springs CBD.

title.children: 27yo in critical condition after Alice Springs stabbing brawl

image.altText: A close up shot of an African man with a moustache and greying short hair.

props.synopsis:
A Legal Aid NT board member who resigned over the attorney-general making a "captain's pick" for the organisation's director position has spoken out, claiming the minister ignored formal recommendations over two rounds of recruitment.

Â

title.children: Legal Aid NT board member speaks out after string of resignations

image.altText: A person runs through the bush.

props.synopsis: West Macs Monster event director Simon Duke says more than 500 competitors are lining up for five events across the weekend.

title.children: Outback ultra-marathon runners gear up for Red Centre test

image.altText: A small baby's hand clutching the thumb of a parent.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory health minister has released the details of a replacement service for expectant parents seeking private maternity healthcare in Darwin. Here's what it includes.

title.children: With the NT's only private maternity ward closing, here's the government's plan

image.altText: A man looks at the camera with a blank expression.

props.synopsis:
Geoff Miers is furious after Alice Springs council razed a Sturt's desert pea display to which he had tended for more than two decades.

Â

title.children: Outback horticulturalist outraged by destruction of roundabout's blooms

image.altText: House debris piled up on a hill

props.synopsis: An inquiry into a series of landslides on the Mornington Peninsula, just outside Melbourne has heard multiple theories as to what caused them. Several theories involve water damage throughout the hillside neighbourhood.

title.children: The collapse of a multi-million-dollar home shocked many. But clues may have bubbled up for weeks

image.altText: Harry Grant looks to one side

props.synopsis: Melbourne captain Harry Grant returns from a hamstring injury as the Storm take on the Sharks in Cronulla. Earlier, Jake Trbojevic was knocked out cold in the first half of Manly's 24-6 win over North Queensland. Follow live.

title.children: Sharks in shootout with Storm after scary scenes for Trbojevic

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Phenomenal hands from the Sharks and Atkinson's in again
The spiral bomb strikes again, this time for Melbourne
Xavier Coates is over for his second of the night

image.altText: A large cargo ship with Hong Tai 58 emblazoned on its front sits docked at a port.

props.synopsis: Taiwan has accused China of carrying out what it calls "grey zone" warfare, which is designed to pressure the island without direct confrontation and psychologically wear down locals ahead of an invasion.

title.children: Why ships lurking in Taiwan's waters could be a 'prelude to a coming war'

image.altText: People sitting around table and having a meeting

props.synopsis: Ukrainian Defence Minister Rustem Umerov says Kyiv and Moscow will exchange 1,000 captives but a date for the swap will not be made public.

title.children: Russia and Ukraine agree prisoner swap deal in first direct talks for years

image.altText: Sussan Ley and her mother Angela Braybrooks.

props.synopsis: Newly appointed federal Liberal leader Sussan Ley pays tribute to her mother, who died during the early hours of Saturday.

title.children: Liberal leader Sussan Ley's mother dies, days after leadership success

image.altText: A photo of grey seashells aligned to spell out 8-6-4-7 on the sand of a beach

props.synopsis: A photo of seashells posted to former FBI director James Comey's Instagram account has sparked controversy in the US, with some saying it is a call for violence against President Donald Trump.

title.children: 'A child knows what he meant': Trump says ex-FBI director's seashell photo is a death threat

image.altText: Illustration of two children playing in rain and mud for the first time, happy and jumping.

props.synopsis: Some kids had never seen a puddle until the Millennium Drought broke. The decade-long dry spell sweeping Australia delivered more than cracked earth, it changed our relationship with water.

title.children: The legacy of Australiaâs worst drought lives on in our bathrooms

image.altText: A man in a striped polo in a glass cell

props.synopsis: Prosecutors in the Russian-controlled part of eastern Ukraine said the Melbourne teacher had been found guilty of participating in an armed conflict as a mercenary.

title.children: Federal government 'appalled' at Russia's 13-year prison sentence for Oscar Jenkins

image.altText: Ben Roberts-Smith in a suit and tie

props.synopsis: Lawyers for former SAS corporal will likely spend the coming days pouring over the reasons for the dismissal of his appeal.

title.children: 'We're talking millions of dollars': Roberts-Smith facing huge costs bill

image.altText: Donald Trump's face shown close up while he frowns and looks to his right

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump takes aim at US music giants Bruce Springsteen and Taylor Swift in blistering posts on social media.

title.children: Trump calls Springsteen a 'dried out prune', says Taylor Swift 'no longer hot'

image.altText: People eat beef pho at a breakfast restaurant in Hanoi

props.synopsis: Pho is a beloved national dish for Vietnamese across borders and political divisions. Some say that means it has potential to heal the deep wounds of civil war.

title.children: Inside the dish that conquered Vietnam and then the world

image.altText: halle berry cannes

props.synopsis: You know someone's all out of runway for their cause when they start throwing around words like "decency".

title.children: Excusez-moi? Cannes Film Festival's dress code is nakedly hypocritical

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: The jury in Erin Patterson's triple-murder trial have been given a masterclass on death cap mushrooms, which caused the deaths of three of her relatives and left one seriously ill.

title.children: Jury hears of mushrooms, medicine and mystery in the Erin Patterson trial

image.altText: crisp doran

props.synopsis: The case of a child sex offender who was on the run for three decades has led to revelations of links between paedophiles who worked at a Queensland Catholic school.

title.children: Church reported concerns about school paedophile links

image.altText: Waratahs head coach Dan McKellar during the warm-up, arms folded, looking intently

props.synopsis: NSW Waratahs coach Dan McKellar has promised a "brutal" review of the organisation following its 48-33 loss to the Crusaders on Friday night.

title.children: Waratahs coach promises 'brutal' review of rugby club

image.altText: A giant illuminated animal sculptures

props.synopsis: Star-gazing, nude solstice swims and spectacular light shows are part of a growing travel trend known as "noctourism" that's injecting hundreds of millions of dollars into Australia's economy each year.

title.children: Rise in after-dark travel drives tourism surge across Australia

image.altText: A tv remote in red and white sepia

props.synopsis: Australian media has evolved from nitrate tapes and VHS into a digital age. It could come with new challenges for the world of cultural preservation.

title.children: Streaming promised a 'golden age' of media. Then shows began disappearing

image.altText: A sheep farmer in a paddock with his 2 school aged children and sheep behind them

props.synopsis: South Australian farmers say putting red meat on the dinner plate is one way for consumers to support them through the drought.

title.children: Farmers call on 'city cousins' to buy red meat amid SA drought

image.altText: A small clear wave breaks onto the sandy shores.

props.synopsis: Next time you're at the beach, take a closer look at the sand. Every grain tells a story of time and transformation.

title.children: Where does beach sand come from?

image.altText: Terrified children, including 9-year-old Kim Phuc, are running after a South Vietnamese plane accidentally dropped napalm

props.synopsis: A World Press Photo report says the suspension comes amid claims in a recent documentary that American-Vietnamese AP photographer Nick Ãt was not the true author of the image.

title.children: Historic Vietnam War photo attribution suspended amid authorship doubts

image.altText: a profile i mage of tongan national Paea Teu wearing glasses who is wanted by police over assault offences

props.synopsis: Paea Teu, 28, was on the run in Sydney's west after two immigration detention centre contractors were allegedly stabbed and assaulted.

title.children: Man charged after immigration detention centre contractors stabbed, assaulted

image.altText: Surf emu

props.synopsis: When a businessman imported emus to his private island on the NSW south coast, he did not realise they could swim for freedom and set up their own thriving colony.

title.children: Emus swam 'like periscopes' to freedom and set up life on the beach

image.altText: Vladimir Putin and Emmanuel Macron sit at opposite ends of a long table at the Kremlin.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is pushing for a chance to face off with Vladimir Putin, a Russian leader known for using power plays and intimidation to dance around negotiations.

title.children: The theatrics of negotiating with Vladimir Putin

image.altText: Murray Watt environment minister

props.synopsis: With his feet just barely under the desk, newly installed Environment Minister Murray Watt will take to Western Australia to restart talks on contentious conservation reforms and a decision this month on whether to extend Woodside's Karratha gas facility beyond 2030.

title.children: Murray Watt confirms rewrite of environmental laws shelved by Albanese

image.altText: Basalts being spread on a macadamia farm.

props.synopsis: A growing number of scientists believe crushed basalt, a volcanic rock used in roads, could be used as a fertiliser, with trials showing it can improve soil and capture carbon.

title.children: Could 'blue metal' be farmingâs next big climate solution?

image.altText: Police tape hanging on a metal fence, wall and windows in the background

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to a Springfield Lakes home on Friday night to reports a woman had collapsed.

title.children: Husband and brother-in-law charged with woman's murder

image.altText: Two hands hold open cut mango.

props.synopsis: Scientists in Queensland are striving to breed the perfect Aussie mango by combining decades of genetic research with sensory science, selecting for flavour, aroma, texture, and disease resistance.

title.children: Why your next favourite mango might take 25 years to grow
